inclusion.criterion: pregnant women undergoing primary or repeat cesarean section
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: maternal age greater than or equal to 18 years of age
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: gestational age greater than or equal to 34 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: a study staff member will describe the study and offer participation
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the patient's prenatal care and labor and delivery will be managed by her physician per standard of care at the physician's discretion
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: pain level will be assessed on the first and third or fourth day after surgery and again at six weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the patient's chart will be flagged, indicating that she is a study participant
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: when a participating patient is scheduled for a cesarean section, she will be randomized to Arm 1 (Staples) or Arm 2 (Prolene) or Arm 3 (Monocryl or Vicryl absorbable suture)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the patient in Arm 1 will have skin closure with staples
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the patient in Arm 2 will have skin closure with 2-0 Prolene in a subcuticular fashion
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: the patient in Arm 3 will have skin closure with monocryl or vicryl in the standard fashion
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: history of drug or alcohol abuse
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: maternal age less than 18 years of age
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 35-year-old woman with myasthenia gravis, class IIa. She complains of diplopia and fatigue and weakness that affects mainly her upper limbs.
